app_metadata.description: Lens is a collaborative CAD platform for uploading, viewing, and sharing 3D models with version control, export capabilities, and real-time collaboration tools.
app_metadata.name: lens

run_as_context.description: MongoDB and Redis runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Lens

attrs.label: Hostname
attrs.description:
The hostname or IP address where the application will be accessible.</br>
Examples:</br>
- truenas.local</br>
- 192.168.1.100</br>
- lens.example.com

attrs.label: Frontend URL
attrs.description:
Full URL where the frontend will be accessible.</br>
Use the same hostname/IP as configured above, with port 30306 (or your custom port).</br>
Examples:</br>
- http://truenas.local:30306</br>
- http://192.168.1.100:30306</br>
- https://lens.example.com

attrs.label: API URL
attrs.description:
Backend API URL for frontend.</br>
Examples:</br>
- http://truenas.local:30305</br>
- http://192.168.1.100:30305

attrs.label: Stripe Purchase URL
attrs.description: Stripe payment processing URL

attrs.label: Default Admin Email
attrs.description: Email address for the default admin user

attrs.label: Default Admin Username
attrs.description: Username for the default admin user

attrs.label: Admin Password
attrs.description: Password for the default admin user

attrs.label: Admin Name
attrs.description: Display name for the default admin user

attrs.label: Setup Email
attrs.description: Setup email for notifications (password reset, etc).

attrs.label: Email Configuration
attrs.description: Configure email for notifications (password reset, etc).

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode

The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Uploads Storage
attrs.description: The path to store user uploads.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

NFS Share (Mounts a volume to a NFS share)

1.0.6.readme:
Lens

Lens is a collaborative CAD platform for uploading, viewing, and sharing 3D models with version control, export capabilities, and real-time collaboration tools.
